reason: The user explicitly mentions a recent near-fatal overdose, indicating a high level of immediate risk to their well-being, even though they are now out of the hospital.

title: User Story: Overdose
content: Saw someone OD downtown today. Scariest thing ever. They're ok now, thank goodness. Makes you realize how fragile things are. Please, look out for each other. Naloxone saves lives. Know how to use it.
reason: An overdose occurred, indicating a potential for serious harm or death, though the individual is now reported to be okay. The mention of Naloxone highlights the risk of opioid-related emergencies.

title: User Story: Self-Harm

title: User Story: Self-Harm

reason: Relapse indicates potential for harmful behavior; shame suggests distress, and reaching out to a therapist is a positive mitigating factor. The phrase 'things got really bad' warrants concern and suggests an event occurred that led to a relapse.

title: User Story: Violence
